title: The 'American dream' of the growing number of Indians illegally migrating to the US
summary: On December 21, a plane carrying some 300 Indian passengers was grounded in France on suspicion of illegal immigration. The incident highlights the spectacular increase in illegal emigration to the US.

title: Macron wishes for unity in the new year, which will welcome the Olympics to France
summary: The French president made reference to the late Jacques Delors during his address

title: DR Congo leader Tshisekedi wins second term in already contested election
summary: The scale of the African president's victory is crushing – garnering about 73% of the ballots cast. The political opposition has made allegations that voting irregularities explain the huge margin.

title: Le Monde's top 10 destinations | #2 Germany's meandering Moselle
summary: Where to travel in 2024? This year, Le Monde answers that question with 10 travel picks accessible by train from France. Discover two travel guides per week throughout December. Number 2: Germany's Moselle Valley.

title: Ukrainians face prospect of extended conscription: 'One day or another, we'll all have to go'
summary: On December 19, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky announced the likely mobilization of almost 500,000 new recruits, even though thousands of soldiers have not been relieved in 22 months. But with the war bogged down, momentum has waned.

title: Fractures in Hollywood over Israel-Hamas conflict
summary: Since the Hamas attack on Israel on October 7, a debate has been raging between staunch supporters of Israel and those who condemn the bombardments in Gaza. The divide reveals the sociological and ideological changes underway in Hollywood.

title: Danish queen says will abdicate on January 14
summary: Citing her age and health issues, Queen Margrethe made the announcement during her traditional New Year's Eve speech broadcast on Danish television.

title: Xi says China will 'surely be reunified' with self-ruled Taiwan in New Year's address
summary: Taiwan split from China amid civil war in 1949, but Beijing continues to regard the island of 23 million with its high-tech economy as Chinese territory and has been ramping up its threat to achieve that by military force if necessary.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Arab human rights defenders sanctioned by Western donors
summary: Civil society organizations in several Middle Eastern countries have lost European funding after condemning the Israeli offensive in Gaza. Their leaders criticize the censorship that weakens them in the face of the authoritarian regimes they oppose.

title: 'Jacques Delors and the Parti Socialiste: A troubled relationship'
summary: Historian Mathieu Fulla recalls that the former European Commission president, who died on December 27, had long favored forms of activism other than politics, only joining the Parti Socialiste in 1974.

title: Eurostar to resume normal services Sunday after a full day of cancellations
summary: All trips on the service that runs from London to Paris, Brussels and Amsterdam were canceled on Saturday due to flooding in UK tunnels, stranding thousands of passengers just ahead of New Year's Eve.

title: Arrival of British warship in Guyana rekindles tensions between UK and Venezuela
summary: In response to the presence of the Royal Navy vessel, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has deployed new troops to the border of Essequibo, a Guyanese territory claimed by Caracas.

title: From Minecraft to Roblox, children's favorite games have become havens for hackers
summary: The immense popularity of these online games and their highly-developed ecosystems make them a prime target for scams and hacking campaigns. They also act as a testing ground for budding hackers.

title: The year in review: 2023 in six minutes
summary: The war in Ukraine, Hamas's attack on Israel, riots in France... Le Monde recaps the major events of 2023 in our video.

title: School uniforms in France: The story of a failed experiment
summary: With the education minister exploring standardized outfits for students, a 2018 experiment by a small town French mayor highlights the challenges of such an initiative.

title: Moroccan political and business leaders caught up in international drug trafficking case
summary: Twenty individuals, including the president of the country's most successful football club and a regional president, have been placed into custody in Casablanca.

title: Science highlights of 2023: Cosmic images, a genetic hybrid ape, a necropolis in Paris...
summary: Discover the highlights of a year of scientific and medical news, as well as the inspiring people who left their mark on 2023.

title: In 2024, the risk of a recession looms in the wake of inflation
summary: The number-one risk for the economy will be... geopolitics. The aftermath of Russia's war in Ukraine, potential escalation of the Israel-Hamas conflict and persistent unrest in the Red Sea region will weigh heavily in the economic equation.
